Test_Description: Measures 17-hydroxyprogesterone levels to diagnose congenital adrenal hyperplasia and other hormonal disorders.
Assesses vitamin D levels to evaluate bone health, immune function, and overall wellness.
Comprehensive panel to diagnose arthritis and related conditions.
Evaluates cholesterol levels and cardiovascular health risks.
Test_Parameters_Included: Total Cholesterol, HDL, LDL, Triglycerides, VLDL

Test_Description: Measures 17-hydroxyprogesterone levels to diagnose congenital adrenal hyperplasia or monitor adrenal disorders. Useful for evaluating conditions like PCOS or infertility.
Assesses vitamin D levels to evaluate bone health, immune function, and deficiencies. Low levels may indicate osteoporosis or rickets risk.
Measures DHT levels, a potent androgen, to evaluate conditions like male pattern baldness, prostate issues, or hirsutism in women.
Determines blood type (A, B, AB, O) and Rh factor (positive/negative) for transfusions, pregnancy, or organ donation compatibility.
Counts basophils (a type of white blood cell) to diagnose allergies, infections, or blood disorders. Elevated levels may indicate allergic reactions.
Measures eosinophils to diagnose allergies, parasitic infections, or autoimmune diseases. High counts often indicate allergic conditions.
Counts lymphocytes to assess immune system health. Abnormal levels may indicate infections, leukemia, or immune deficiencies.
Measures neutrophils to evaluate immune response to infections or bone marrow disorders. Low counts may indicate neutropenia.
Detects antibodies linked to myasthenia gravis, an autoimmune neuromuscular disease. Helps diagnose muscle weakness causes.
Measures acid phosphatase levels to assess prostate health or bone disorders. Elevated levels may indicate prostate cancer.
Evaluates blood clotting ability to diagnose bleeding disorders or monitor heparin therapy. Prolonged times may indicate hemophilia.
Measures albumin in body fluids (e.g., pleural, peritoneal) to diagnose infections or malignancies. Helps assess fluid accumulation causes.
Assesses albumin levels to evaluate liver function, kidney health, or nutritional status. Low levels may indicate malnutrition or liver disease.
Measures albumin relative to creatinine to detect early kidney damage, especially in diabetes. High ratios suggest kidney dysfunction.
Compares albumin to globulin levels to assess liver or immune system health. Abnormal ratios may indicate chronic diseases.
Detects ethanol levels in blood to confirm alcohol consumption or intoxication. Used in medical or legal evaluations.
Tests for ethanol in urine to monitor recent alcohol use. Often used in workplace or legal testing.
Measures bicarbonate levels to assess acid-base balance in the body. Abnormal levels may indicate respiratory or metabolic disorders.
Evaluates bilirubin levels to assess liver function or diagnose jaundice. High levels may indicate liver disease or hemolysis.

Test_Name: Bleeding Time and Clotting Time (BT, CT)
Test_Description: Assesses blood clotting efficiency to diagnose bleeding disorders. Prolonged times may indicate platelet dysfunction.
Measures urea levels to evaluate kidney function. High levels indicate kidney disease or dehydration.
Detects inflammation or infection by measuring CRP levels. Elevated levels indicate conditions like arthritis or infections.
Measures calcium levels to assess bone health, kidney function, or parathyroid disorders. Abnormal levels may indicate osteoporosis or hyperparathyroidism.
Evaluates chloride levels to assess electrolyte balance. Abnormalities may indicate kidney or metabolic disorders.
Measures HDL (good cholesterol) to assess cardiovascular health. Low HDL levels increase heart disease risk.
Measures LDL (bad cholesterol) to evaluate heart disease risk. High levels are associated with atherosclerosis.
Assesses total cholesterol levels to monitor cardiovascular health. High levels may indicate increased heart disease risk.
Measures red blood cells, white blood cells, hemoglobin, and platelets to assess overall health. Detects anemia, infections, or blood disorders.
Measures creatinine and calculates GFR to assess kidney function. Low GFR indicates kidney damage or failure.
Measures inflammation by how quickly red blood cells settle. Elevated ESR indicates infections or autoimmune diseases.
Assesses iron storage to diagnose anemia or iron overload. Low levels indicate iron deficiency; high levels suggest hemochromatosis.
Measures folate levels to diagnose anemia or nutritional deficiencies. Low levels may affect red blood cell production.
Measures fasting blood sugar to diagnose or monitor diabetes. High levels indicate hyperglycemia.

Test_Name: Glucose Post Prandial (Blood Sugar Post Prandial)
Test_Description: Measures blood sugar after a meal to assess diabetes control. Elevated levels suggest poor glucose regulation.
Measures blood sugar at any time to screen for diabetes or hypoglycemia. Used for quick glucose assessment.
Assesses glucose metabolism over time to diagnose diabetes or gestational diabetes. Involves three blood samples after glucose intake.
A detailed test to evaluate glucose metabolism with five samples. Used for diagnosing diabetes or insulin resistance.
Measures average blood sugar over 2–3 months to monitor diabetes control. High HbA1c indicates poor glucose management.
Measures hemoglobin levels to diagnose anemia or monitor oxygen-carrying capacity. Low levels indicate anemia or blood loss.
Measures iron levels to diagnose anemia or iron overload. Low iron may indicate deficiency; high levels suggest hemochromatosis.
Includes iron, TIBC, and ferritin to assess iron metabolism. Detects anemia, iron deficiency, or overload conditions.
Measures cholesterol (total, HDL, LDL) and triglycerides to assess heart disease risk. High levels indicate cardiovascular concerns.
Evaluates liver health through tests like bilirubin, SGOT, SGPT, and albumin. Detects liver diseases like hepatitis or cirrhosis.
Examines blood cells under a microscope to diagnose blood disorders. Detects abnormalities in cell shape or size.
Measures immature red blood cells to assess bone marrow function. High counts indicate anemia recovery or hemolysis.
Measures AST enzyme to assess liver or heart damage. Elevated levels may indicate hepatitis or myocardial infarction.
Measures ALT enzyme to evaluate liver health. High levels suggest liver damage or disease.
Assesses the blood’s capacity to bind iron. Used with iron tests to diagnose anemia or iron overload.
Measures urea levels to evaluate kidney function. High levels indicate kidney disease or dehydration.
Measures uric acid to diagnose gout or kidney stones. High levels may indicate metabolic disorders.
Assesses vitamin B12 levels to diagnose anemia or neurological issues. Low levels indicate deficiency or malabsorption.
Measures ACTH to evaluate adrenal gland function. Abnormal levels may indicate Cushing’s syndrome or Addison’s disease.
Measures aldosterone to assess blood pressure regulation and adrenal function. High levels may indicate primary aldosteronism.
Measures insulin production to differentiate between type 1 and type 2 diabetes. Low levels suggest type 1 diabetes.
Measures DHEA-S to assess adrenal function or PCOS. Elevated levels may indicate adrenal tumors.
Measures estrogen levels to evaluate fertility, menopause, or hormonal imbalances. Useful in reproductive health assessments.
Assesses FSH levels to evaluate fertility or pituitary function. Abnormal levels may indicate infertility or menopause.
Detects BHCG to confirm pregnancy or monitor certain cancers. Elevated levels may indicate pregnancy or tumors.
Measures growth hormone to diagnose growth disorders or pituitary issues. Abnormal levels may indicate acromegaly or dwarfism.
Measures fasting insulin levels to assess diabetes or insulin resistance. High levels suggest metabolic syndrome.
Measures insulin after a meal to evaluate glucose metabolism. Used in diabetes or insulin resistance diagnosis.
Measures insulin levels at any time to assess metabolic disorders. Helps diagnose insulinomas or diabetes.
Measures LH to evaluate fertility or pituitary function. Abnormal levels may indicate PCOS or infertility.
Measures progesterone to assess ovulation or pregnancy health. Low levels may indicate miscarriage risk.
Measures prolactin to evaluate pituitary function or fertility issues. High levels may indicate prolactinoma.
Measures free testosterone to assess hormonal health or infertility. Useful for diagnosing low libido or hypogonadism.
Measures total testosterone to evaluate reproductive or adrenal health. Low levels may indicate hypogonadism.
Evaluates thyroid function to diagnose hypothyroidism or hyperthyroidism. Abnormal levels indicate thyroid disorders.
Measures T3, T4, and TSH to assess thyroid function comprehensively. Detects hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism, or pituitary issues.

Test_Name: Thyroid Profile -5 (FT3, FT4, T3, T4, TSH)
Test_Description: A detailed thyroid panel including free and total T3/T4 to diagnose complex thyroid disorders. Provides a complete thyroid health overview.
Measures T3 levels to assess thyroid function. High levels may indicate hyperthyroidism.
Measures T4 levels to evaluate thyroid health. Abnormal levels suggest thyroid dysfunction.
Monitors ovarian cancer or detects conditions like endometriosis. Elevated levels may indicate malignancy.
Measures CA15.3 to monitor breast cancer progression or recurrence. High levels may indicate metastatic disease.
Detects CA19.9 to monitor pancreatic or gastrointestinal cancers. Elevated levels suggest malignancy.
Measures CEA to monitor colorectal or other cancers. High levels may indicate cancer recurrence.
Detects CYFRA 21-1 to monitor lung cancer. Elevated levels suggest non-small cell lung cancer.
Measures free PSA to assess prostate health. Helps differentiate between benign prostate issues and cancer.
Measures total PSA to screen for prostate cancer or benign prostatic hyperplasia. Elevated levels may indicate prostate issues.
A panel of cancer markers (e.g., CA125, CA15.3) to screen for female-specific cancers like ovarian or breast cancer.
A panel of cancer markers (e.g., PSA, CEA) to screen for male-specific cancers like prostate or colorectal cancer.

Test_Name: AFB Stain (Z N Stain) 1st Sample for Fluid
Test_Description: Detects acid-fast bacilli in body fluids to diagnose tuberculosis. Used for pleural or peritoneal fluid analysis.

Test_Name: AFB Stain (Z N Stain) 1st Sample for Pus
Test_Description: Identifies tuberculosis-causing bacteria in pus samples. Helps diagnose TB infections in wounds.

Test_Name: AFB Stain (Z N Stain) 1st Sample for Sputum
Test_Description: Detects tuberculosis bacteria in sputum. Used for pulmonary TB diagnosis.

Test_Name: AFB Stain (Z N Stain) 1st Sample for Urine
Test_Description: Identifies TB bacteria in urine to diagnose genitourinary tuberculosis. Useful for kidney or bladder infections.
Cultures blood to detect aerobic bacterial infections. Identifies bloodstream infections like sepsis.
Detects IgG antibodies to diagnose chronic brucellosis. Indicates past exposure to Brucella bacteria.
Detects IgM antibodies for recent Brucella infection. Used to diagnose acute brucellosis.
Detects IgG antibodies to confirm past chikungunya infection. Helps assess immunity post-infection.
Detects IgM antibodies to diagnose recent chikungunya infection. Indicates active or recent viral exposure.
Detects past CMV exposure through IgG antibodies. Used in pregnancy or transplant screening.
Detects recent CMV infection through IgM antibodies. Indicates active infection, especially in immunocompromised patients.
Detects NS1 antigen for early dengue diagnosis. Identifies infection within the first few days of symptoms.
Detects IgG antibodies to confirm past dengue infection. Helps assess immunity or previous exposure.
Detects IgM antibodies to diagnose recent dengue infection. Indicates active or recent dengue fever.

Test_Name: Hepatitis A Virus IgG Antibodies (HAV IgG)
Test_Description: Detects past hepatitis A exposure through IgG antibodies. Confirms immunity from infection or vaccination.
Detects recent hepatitis A infection through IgM antibodies. Indicates active liver infection.

Test_Name: Hepatitis B Core Antibody IgM (HBc IgM)
Test_Description: Detects recent hepatitis B infection. Indicates acute or recent HBV exposure.
Detects hepatitis B virus to diagnose active infection. Used for screening or monitoring HBV.
Confirms hepatitis B infection using ELISA method. A reliable test for HBV screening.
Detects hepatitis C virus to diagnose active infection. Used for liver disease screening.
Detects past hepatitis E exposure through IgG antibodies. Confirms immunity or previous infection.
Detects recent hepatitis E infection through IgM antibodies. Indicates active liver infection.
Detects past HSV-1 infection (e.g., oral herpes) through IgG antibodies. Confirms previous exposure.
Screens for HIV-1 and HIV-2 infections using ELISA. A standard test for HIV diagnosis.
A quick test to detect HIV-1 and HIV-2 antibodies. Used for rapid screening.
Detects tuberculosis DNA in blood for rapid TB diagnosis. Highly sensitive for early detection.
Detects recent rubella infection through IgM antibodies. Important for pregnancy screening to prevent congenital issues.
Detects past typhoid fever exposure through IgG antibodies. Confirms immunity or previous infection.
Detects recent typhoid fever through IgM antibodies. Indicates active or recent Salmonella infection.
Cultures sputum to identify bacterial infections like pneumonia or TB. Determines antibiotic sensitivity.
Cultures urine to detect urinary tract infections. Identifies bacteria and their antibiotic sensitivity.
Detects past chickenpox or shingles exposure through IgG antibodies. Confirms immunity.
Detects recent chickenpox or shingles infection through IgM antibodies. Indicates active infection.
Tests for contact allergies to substances like metals or chemicals. Helps identify skin allergy triggers.
A panel to detect common allergens (e.g., dust, pollen). Useful for diagnosing allergic reactions.
An extended panel for multiple allergen testing. Identifies specific allergy triggers.
Tests for skin-related allergens causing dermatitis or rashes. Helps pinpoint allergy sources.
Tests for allergies to vegetarian foods (e.g., nuts, grains). Identifies food-related allergic reactions.
Detects antibodies linked to Crohn’s disease. Aids in diagnosing inflammatory bowel diseases.
Detects past Aspergillus exposure, linked to lung infections. Used in immunocompromised patients.
Detects recent Aspergillus infection. Indicates active fungal infection in lungs.
Measures rheumatoid factor to diagnose rheumatoid arthritis. High levels indicate autoimmune joint disease.
Detects antibodies linked to scleroderma. Helps diagnose systemic sclerosis.
Cultures cervical swab to detect bacterial infections. Used for diagnosing reproductive tract infections.
Cultures ear swab to identify infections like otitis media. Determines antibiotic sensitivity.
Cultures eye swab to diagnose conjunctivitis or other infections. Identifies causative bacteria.
Cultures nasal swab to detect bacterial infections like sinusitis. Identifies pathogens and antibiotic sensitivity.
Cultures pus to detect anaerobic bacterial infections. Used for deep tissue or wound infections.
Cultures pus to identify aerobic bacterial infections. Determines antibiotic sensitivity for treatment.
Cultures semen to detect infections affecting male fertility. Identifies bacteria causing reproductive issues.
Cultures sputum to identify bacterial infections like pneumonia or TB. Determines antibiotic sensitivity.
Cultures throat swab to diagnose infections like strep throat. Identifies bacteria and their antibiotic sensitivity.
Cultures vaginal swab to detect bacterial or yeast infections. Used for diagnosing vaginal infections.
Screens for arthritis and autoimmune conditions affecting joints. Includes basic markers for inflammation and joint health.
A comprehensive panel for diagnosing rheumatoid arthritis and related conditions. Includes additional autoimmune markers.

Test_Description: An extended arthritis panel for detailed autoimmune assessment. Useful for diagnosing complex joint disorders.

Test_Description: Assesses basic heart health to screen for cardiovascular risks. Includes lipid and inflammation markers.
